definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: clarion (NH [[חֲחוֹחֶרֶת]], Aram. [[חֲחוֹחַרְתָּח]])—mostly P and late;—abs. ´[[ח]] Ho 5:8; pl. abs. [[חֲחׂחְרוֹת]] Nu 10:8 + 22 t.; [[חֲחׂחְרׂת]] Nu 10:9, Nu 10:10; cstr. id. Nu 31:6, 2Ch 13:12; [[חֲחוֹחְרׂת]] Nu 10:2; clarion:
as sacred instr. 2Ki 12:14, esp. for use by priests (only P, Ps 98 and Chr).

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: ´[[תקע בח]] (of blowing a single long blast) Nu 10:3, Nu 10:4, Nu 10:7, Nu 10:8, to gather congreg. or ´[[נשׂיא]] together, and, on festivals, over sacrif., ‘ to be remembered before ´[[י]], ’ v:Nu 10:10.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: ´[[תקע תרועה בח]], or ´[[הריע בח]] (of sounding alarm,—a series of quick blasts) for camps to move Nu 10:5, Nu 10:6, also in battle, v:Nu 10:9, ‘ to be remembered before ´[[י]]; ’ so Nu 31:6, 2Ch 13:12 (cf. v:2Ch 13:14), both [[התרועה]] ´[[ח]].

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: esp. in Chr's descriptions of ceremonies at festivals, to express rejoicing: 1Ch 13:8, 1Ch 15:28 (‖[[קוֹל שׁוֹפָר]]), 1Ch 16:6, 1Ch 16:42, 2Ch 15:14 (‖[[שׁוֹפָר]]), 2Ch 20:28, 2Ch 29:26, 2Ch 29:27, Ezr 3:10, Ne 12:35, Ne 12:41, Ps 98:6 (‖[[קוֹל שׁוֹפָר]]); ´[[הָרִים קוֹל בח]] 2Ch 5:13; ´[[מחחחרים בח]] 1Ch 15:24, 2Ch 5:12, 2Ch 5:13, 2Ch 13:14; in 2Ch 29:28 this pt. agrees with noun in sense, and is masc.; and the clarions (= players on the clarions) sounded.—The [[חֲחׂחְרָה]], or (sacred) clarion, was a long, straight, slender metal tube, with flaring end, v. Benz:Archäol. 277; distinguished thus from the [[שׁוֹפָר]] which was originally a ram's horn, and prob. always retained the horn-shape; the [[שׁוֹפָר]] is mentioned constantly in the earlier lit., and was used by watchmen, warriors, etc., as well as priests (v. Benz:ib. 276 and [[שׁוֹפָר]]).
